alert.note: Alert for Upshur; Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 3:30PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central West Virginia, central West Virginia and northern West Virginia, including the following counties, in Central West Virginia, Braxton. In central West Virginia, Webster. In northern West Virginia, Barbour, Harrison, Lewis and Upshur. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buckhannon, Weston, Philippi, Sutton, Audra State Park, Stonewall Jackson, Rock Cave, Jackson Mill, Burnsville, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Flatwoods, Horner, Walkersville, Lorentz, French Creek, Ireland, Sand Run, Camden and Kanawha Head. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
